document.docTitle: Georissus (Neogeorissus) takahashii Yasuda & Yoshitomi 2022, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Georissus (Coleoptera, Hydrophiloidea, Georissidae) of Japan

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Georissus (Coleoptera, Hydrophiloidea, Georissidae) of Japan

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Entomological Laboratory, Faculty of Agriculture, Ehime University, Tarumi 3 - 5 - 7, Matsuyama, 790 - 8566 Japan.
Entomological Laboratory, Faculty of Agriculture, Ehime University, Tarumi 3 - 5 - 7, Matsuyama, 790 - 8566 Japan.

subSubSection.paragraph:
This species is easily distinguished from other Japanese species of
Georissus
by the elevated intervals 2, 4, 6.
This species name is dedicated to Dr Keiichi Takahashi, the collector of the type series.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype
JAPAN –
Okinawa : Iriomote-jima
• ♂ ; Nishifunatsuki-gawa ;

sp. nov. Abbreviation: vt = ventral teeth. Scale bars = 100 μm.

subSubSection.paragraph: ELYTRA. Humeral bulges distinct, bearing granules. Intervals 2, 4, 6 highly elevated, with distinct granules. Elytral punctures regular square, seriate and distinct. Lateral ridges on each elytron highly elevate, bearing distinct granules. Hind wings fully developed.

MALE GENITALIA ( Fig. 9F–G ). Aedeagus 0.32 mm long. Parameres shorter than phallobase, their basal portions combined as wide as anterior portion of phallobase; lateral margins bulbous at basal portion. Median lobe longer than parameres, widening basally, obtuse at apex; basal struts long. Phallobase about 2.2 times as long as wide, subparallel-sided; posterior portion with large basal foramen.
This species was collected under rocks near a river (Y. Hisasue pers. com.). Specimens from Kochi Prefecture were collected using a car net trap.
Japan : Shikoku ( Kochi Pref.), Okinawa (Okinawa-jima, Ishigaki-jima, Iriomote-jima) ( Fig. 13 ).
